recommendations.non_reactive: You have no immunity against Hepatitis A. Vaccination is recommended as Hepatitis A is a viral liver disease that can cause mild to severe illness. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

medical_tests.remarks: Hep B Carrier status unknown, assume no

recommendations.reactive: You are a Hepatitis B carrier. Generally, 6 monthly liver function, AFP blood tests, and an annual liver ultrasound are recommended to screen for liver tumour associated with Hepatitis B carrier status. You should also abstain from alcohol. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

You are a Hepatitis B carrier. Generally, 6 monthly liver function, AFP blood tests, and an annual liver ultrasound are recommended to screen for liver tumour associated with Hepatitis B carrier status. You should also abstain from alcohol. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

recommendations.non_reactive: You have no immunity against Hepatitis B. Vaccination is recommended as Hepatitis B can cause severe liver failure and liver cancer. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

recommendations.weakly_reactive: You had a Hepatitis C infection that may require treatment. Hepatitis C is a viral infection that causes liver inflammation, sometimes leading to serious liver damage. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
recommendations.reactive: You had a Hepatitis C infection that may require treatment. Hepatitis C is a viral infection that causes liver inflammation, sometimes leading to serious liver damage. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

recommendations.positive: This is suggestive of possible H. pylori infection in your stomach. A course of antibiotics may be required. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

recommendations.equivocal: You may have a Helicobacter pylori infection. A Urea Breath Test and a course of antibiotics may be recommended. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
recommendations.positive: You have a Helicobacter pylori infection. A course of antibiotics may be required. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

Your anti-nuclear antibody test result is positive. Presence of anti-nuclear antibodies may suggest viral infection or other autoimmune disorders such as systemic lupus erythematosus, and rheumatoid arthritis. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

recommendations.low_risk: Your anti-dsDNA is negative, and/or puts you at low risk for autoimmune disorders.
recommendations.borderline: Your anti-dsDNA is borderline elevated. This may be a false positve result or you may have underlying risk for autoimmune disorders. A repeat blood test is recommended. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
recommendations.elevated: Your anti-dsDNA is elevated, and/or it is usually associated with systemic lupus erythematosus. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

recommendations.non_reactive: You have no immunity against Rubella virus. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
recommendations.reactive: Your Rubella antibody indicate a previous exposure/immunization to rubella. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
Your Rubella antibody indicate a recent exposure to rubella virus. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
